messages.subject: Re: Re: What is the SCA...expensive hat

messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/7/99 9:49:13 AM EST, diasberry@... writes:

<< Idea: make sure you bring your camera and take a photo of your dd trying
on
the hat! much cheaper than 110 bucks! >>

And maybe after that you could learn how to make one of your own?
Lori in TX

messages.subject: Re: What is the SCA...expensive hat
messages.msgSnippet: Idea: make sure you bring your camera and take a photo of your dd trying on the hat!  much cheaper than 110 bucks! Diana A. the world is our classroom ... I
messages.messageBody:
Idea: make sure you bring your camera and take a photo of your dd trying on
the hat! much cheaper than 110 bucks!
Diana A.
"the world is our classroom"


----Original Message Follows----
I
certainly found myself wishing that I were independently wealthy when my 14
yo dd tried on a hat that looked so-oo-oo adorable it brought tears to my
eyes. I said "Oh, we must buy that!" Then asked how much it was. $110!!!
But I gotta tell you, if I'd had that kind of money to spend on a hat, I
would have bought it in a heartbeat.

Jane

> I just have to say, I don't consider it "commercial" when almost all of
the
> vendors are independent artists and businesspeople selling their own
works.
> They are exactly the type of artisans that I prefer to partonize, and
many
> of their wares are difficult or impossible to find in other venues

messages.subject: Re: Re: What is the SCA...expensive hat
messages.msgSnippet: ... trying ... Well, ladies, I love the idea of a camera--we are a camera irresponsible family, NEVER have family pictures, no one ever thinks to bring a
messages.messageBody:
> From: RRAINENJ@...
>
> In a message dated 9/7/99 9:49:13 AM EST, diasberry@... writes:
>
> << Idea: make sure you bring your camera and take a photo of your dd
trying
> on
> the hat! much cheaper than 110 bucks! >>
>
> And maybe after that you could learn how to make one of your own?
> Lori in TX
>

Well, ladies, I love the idea of a camera--we are a camera irresponsible
family, NEVER have family pictures, no one ever thinks to bring a camera,
and if they do, we never get them developed. Relatives are always nagging
me for pictures and I never have them. It is one of my serious character
flaws.

As far as making the hat--well, I'm a pretty skillful seamstress, but I
think something like that hat was beyond my level. Now if you suggested
that dd learn to make the hat.... ;-) (Actually, she is making a costume
for the next fair, personally I think the pattern she has picked out is way
more than she can handle, so I will probably end up doing the bulk of the
work.)

Jane
